snippet: Azamat Tazhayakov, 20, a college friend of the surviving Boston bombing suspect, is accused of hindering the investigation into the 2013 attack at the Boston Marathon.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation agent testifies in trial of Azamat Tazhayakov, college friend of surviving Boston Marathon bombing suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev; prosecutors are seeking to prove that Tazhayakov was one of two men who removed items from Tsarnaev's dormitory room following the bombing once they realized he was a suspect.
lead_paragraph: Azamat Tazhayakov, 20, a college friend of the surviving Boston bombing suspect, is accused of hindering the investigation into the 2013 attack at the Boston Marathon.

headline.main: Testimony in Boston Bomb Trial Focuses on Backpack
headline.print_headline: Testimony in Boston Bomb Trial Focuses on Backpack
